TITLE: Cryptone
HELP_TEXT:
How does it work?

This program allows you to encrypt and decrypt files to protect your information from unauthorized access. It uses two main mechanisms for this:

  1. Public and Private Keys
    • Public Key — this is something that can be shared with anyone through any means, including open communication channels. It is used for file encryption.
    • Private Key — this is your personal key that is required for decrypting (unlocking) the file. IMPORTANT!!! It must be kept secret and not shared with anyone.
  2. Password (optional)
    • A password adds an additional layer of security.
    • If you set a password, even someone with the correct private key won't be able to unlock the file without entering this password.
    • If no password is set, the system relies only on the keys.

How does it work in practice?

File encryption

If you want to receive an encrypted file from someone, you:
  1. Generate a pair of private and public keys.
  2. Share the PUBLIC key with the person who has the file you need.
  3. That person selects YOUR public key and encrypts the necessary file/files using this key.
  4. Optionally adds a password.

The program will create an encrypted file that cannot be read without the private key and, if present, the password.

File decryption:

  1. The person sends you the encrypted file in any way (even through open channels).
  2. You select the encrypted file and choose your PRIVATE key for decryption. If the file is password-protected, enter the password.
  3. Click the "Decrypt" button. If the key and password are correct, the program will restore the original file.

What’s important to know?

  • Key Security: Your private key is the most critical element of security. If someone gains access to it, they will be able to unlock your encrypted files.
  • Password as Additional Security: Even if your private key is stolen, having a password will make access to the file nearly impossible.
  • Don’t Lose Your Keys: If you lose your private key or forget your password, it will be IMPOSSIBLE to recover the files!!!
